Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the UK government is concealing the true number of deaths related to the Covid-19 vaccination drive.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a screenshot of a tweet and does not provide any concrete evidence or data to support the assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Office for National Statistics (ONS) should be responsible for publishing data on deaths and side effects related to the Covid-19 vaccination, which is a problematic assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the UK's Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) is responsible for publishing data on adverse reactions to Covid-19 vaccinations, not the ONS.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the ONS does not publish data on deaths and side effects related to the Covid-19 vaccination because it is the responsibility of the MHRA.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misattributing the responsibility of publishing data to the ONS instead of the MHRA.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
